sect2.title: Creating a Staging
sect2.para: At the moment, the Staging is only accessible by hand. "/staging_workflows/new?project=openSUSE:Factory" The creation of a Staging will automatically create two staging projects as a subproject of the main project. Before create we need to select a group of managers, they will be in charge of assign requests to the staging projects and also exclude requests from the Staging.

note.para: An Admin should previously create the manager groups.

sect2.title: Start using it
sect2.para: In this view, we could find all the staging projects with a request associated and also if the requests have some problems.

listitem.para: Managers: Shows the group that are the Staging Mangers
Empty projects: Staging projects without and requests assigned.
Backlog: List of requests that can be assigned to a staging project.
Ready: List of requests that were in the backlog and have a review accepted.
Ignored: List of requests excluded from this Staging.

sect2.title: Configuration
sect2.para: The configuration of a Staging is very intuitive. We are able to create/delete staging projects (openSUSE:Factory:Staging:A, openSUSE:Factory:Staging:B, etc) and change the Managers Group of the Staging.

note.para: Changing the Managers Group of a Stanging will automatically unassign the old group and assing the new group to the related staging projects.

sect2.title: Staging Project
sect2.para: A staging project contains requests assigned by a Staging Manager. An overview page is provided for a staging project where you can find more detailed information about the requests, reviews and checks.

listitem.para: Obsolete Requests: Requests that was declined, revoked or superseded.
Missing Reviews: Requests with pendings reviews.
Building Repositories: List of packages that are still building.
Broken Packages: List of packages with failling builds.
Checks: List of checks of the staging project.
